verses.text: When \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* \w perceived|strong="H3045"\w* all that was \w done|strong="H6213"\w*, \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* \w rent|strong="H7167"\w* his \w clothes|strong="H0899"\w*, and put \w on|strong="H3847"\w* \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w* with \w ashes|strong="H0665"\w*, and went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* into the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w cried|strong="H2199"\w* with a \w loud|strong="H1419"\w* and a \w bitter|strong="H4751"\w* \w cry|strong="H2201"\w*;

And \w came|strong="H0935"\w* even \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*: for none \add might\add* \w enter|strong="H0935"\w* into the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w gate|strong="H8179"\w* \w clothed|strong="H3830"\w* with \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w*.

And in every \w province|strong="H4082"\w*, \w whithersoever|strong="H4725"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w commandment|strong="H1697"\w* and his \w decree|strong="H1881"\w* \w came|strong="H5060"\w*, \add there was\add* \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w mourning|strong="H0060"\w* among the \w Jews|strong="H3064"\w*, and \w fasting|strong="H6685"\w*, and \w weeping|strong="H1065"\w*, and \w wailing|strong="H4553"\w*; and \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w lay|strong="H3331"\w* in \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w* and \w ashes|strong="H0665"\w*.\f + \fr 4.3 \ft many…: Heb. sackcloth and ashes were laid under many\f*

¶ So \w Esther’s|strong="H0635"\w* \w maids|strong="H5291"\w* and her \w chamberlains|strong="H5631"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* and \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \add it\add* her. Then was the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* \w exceedingly|strong="H3966"\w* \w grieved|strong="H2342"\w*; and she \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w raiment|strong="H0899"\w* to \w clothe|strong="H3847"\w* \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*, and to take \w away|strong="H5493"\w* his \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w* from him: but he \w received|strong="H6901"\w* \add it\add* not.\f + \fr 4.4 \ft chamberlains: Heb. eunuchs\f*

Then \w called|strong="H7121"\w* \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* for \w Hatach|strong="H2047"\w*, \add one\add* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w chamberlains|strong="H5631"\w*, whom he had \w appointed|strong="H5975"\w* to \w attend|strong="H6440"\w* upon her, and gave him a \w commandment|strong="H6680"\w* to \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*, to \w know|strong="H3045"\w* what it \add was\add*, and why it \add was\add*.\f + \fr 4.5 \ft appointed…: Heb. set before her\f*

So \w Hatach|strong="H2047"\w* went \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* to \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* unto the \w street|strong="H7339"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, which \add was\add* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*.

And \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* \w told|strong="H5046"\w* him of all that had \w happened|strong="H7136"\w* unto him, and of the \w sum|strong="H6575"\w* of the \w money|strong="H3701"\w* that \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* had \w promised|strong="H0559"\w* to \w pay|strong="H8254"\w* to the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w treasuries|strong="H1595"\w* for the \w Jews|strong="H3064"\w*, to \w destroy|strong="H0006"\w* them.

Also he \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* him the \w copy|strong="H6572"\w* of the \w writing|strong="H3791"\w* of the \w decree|strong="H1881"\w* that was \w given|strong="H5414"\w* at \w Shushan|strong="H7800"\w* to \w destroy|strong="H8045"\w* them, to \w shew|strong="H7200"\w* \add it\add* unto \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w*, and to \w declare|strong="H5046"\w* \add it\add* unto her, and to \w charge|strong="H6680"\w* her that she should go \w in|strong="H0935"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, to make \w supplication|strong="H2603"\w* unto him, and to make \w request|strong="H1245"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him for her \w people|strong="H5971"\w*.
And \w Hatach|strong="H2047"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* and \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* the \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*.
¶ Again \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* \w spake|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Hatach|strong="H2047"\w*, and gave him \w commandment|strong="H6680"\w* unto \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*;

All the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, and the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w provinces|strong="H4082"\w*, do \w know|strong="H3045"\w*, that whosoever, whether \w man|strong="H0376"\w* or \w woman|strong="H0802"\w*, shall \w come|strong="H0935"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* into the \w inner|strong="H6442"\w* \w court|strong="H2691"\w*, who is not \w called|strong="H7121"\w*, \add there is\add* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w law|strong="H1881"\w* of his to put \add him\add* to \w death|strong="H4191"\w*, \w except|strong="H0905"\w* such to whom the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* shall hold \w out|strong="H3447"\w* the \w golden|strong="H2091"\w* \w sceptre|strong="H8275"\w*, that he may \w live|strong="H2421"\w*: but I have not been \w called|strong="H7121"\w* to come \w in|strong="H0935"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* these \w thirty|strong="H7970"\w* \w days|strong="H3117"\w*.
And they \w told|strong="H5046"\w* to \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* \w Esther’s|strong="H0635"\w* \w words|strong="H1697"\w*.

Then \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* \w commanded|strong="H0559"\w* to \w answer|strong="H7725"\w* \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w*, \w Think|strong="H1819"\w* not with \w thyself|strong="H5315"\w* that thou shalt \w escape|strong="H4422"\w* in the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, more than all the \w Jews|strong="H3064"\w*.

For if thou \w altogether|strong="H2790"\w* holdest thy \w peace|strong="H2790"\w* at this \w time|strong="H6256"\w*, \add then\add* shall there \w enlargement|strong="H7305"\w* and \w deliverance|strong="H2020"\w* \w arise|strong="H5975"\w* to the \w Jews|strong="H3064"\w* from \w another|strong="H0312"\w* \w place|strong="H4725"\w*; but thou and thy \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* shall be \w destroyed|strong="H0006"\w*: and who \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* whether thou art \w come|strong="H5060"\w* to the \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w* for \add such\add* a \w time|strong="H6256"\w* as this?\f + \fr 4.14 \ft enlargement: Heb. respiration\f*
¶ Then \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* \w bade|strong="H0559"\w* \add them\add* \w return|strong="H7725"\w* \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* \add this answer\add*,

\w Go|strong="H3212"\w*, gather \w together|strong="H3664"\w* all the \w Jews|strong="H3064"\w* that are \w present|strong="H4672"\w* in \w Shushan|strong="H7800"\w*, and \w fast|strong="H6684"\w* ye for me, and neither \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* nor \w drink|strong="H8354"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w days|strong="H3117"\w*, \w night|strong="H3915"\w* or \w day|strong="H3117"\w*: I also and my \w maidens|strong="H5291"\w* will \w fast|strong="H6684"\w* likewise; and \w so|strong="H3651"\w* will I \w go|strong="H0935"\w* in unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, which \add is\add* not according to the \w law|strong="H1881"\w*: and if I \w perish|strong="H0006"\w*, I \w perish|strong="H0006"\w*.\f + \fr 4.16 \ft present: Heb. found\f*

So \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* went his \w way|strong="H5674"\w*, and \w did|strong="H6213"\w* according to all that \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* had \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w* him.\f + \fr 4.17 \ft went…: Heb. passed\f*
